How to Install swami on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • swami

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install swami on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing swami on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall swami in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install swami, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install swami Using apt

To install swami in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install swami using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install swami

The installation of swami might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install swami Using apt-get

To install swami using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install swami.

sudo apt-get -y install swami

Install swami Using Synaptic

To install swami using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install swami on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for swami. This will display the swami package in the package window, now to install swami, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the swami package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of swami.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install swami Using aptitude

To install swami on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of swami.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install swami using the command aptitude install swami.

sudo aptitude -y install swami

How to Upgrade swami on debian

If you want to upgrade the swami package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade swami using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade swami to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade swami.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade swami sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade swami

Upgrade swami using Aptitude

To upgrade swami using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade swami.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade swami

Upgrade swami using Synaptic

To upgrade swami using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for swami, now right-click swami, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade swami just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall swami on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall swami from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just swami, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove swami

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of swami

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of swami you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge swami

Remove swami using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall swami using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for swami, right-click the swami package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall swami click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install swami on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade swami using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.
